task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table, using a robot arm to locate, approach, grasp, and lift it.

task_long_description.overview: The robot is tasked with identifying and grasping a red cylindrical object placed on a flat table, using its manipulator. The workspace contains the red object and blue-marked areas but no visible obstructions. The goal is to pick up the red object and lift it safely, which involves perception, approach, grasping with appropriate force, and verifying the object is securely held. All actions are constrained to those visible in the provided contact sheet frames. Robust perception and grasp feedback are expected.
preconditions: Red object on table within reach
stepwise_plan: Check if the red object is visible
Scan area for the red object if needed
Detect the exact location of the red object
Move above red object with correct offset
success_criteria: Red object is in the gripper
Red object is lifted above table with no slip
Robot arm clears the workspace after lifting
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected: retry scan up to 3 times
Grasp not stable: abort lift and retry approach
Gripper fails to close: log and halt execution
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the red object is securely held and lifted from the table

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks whether the red object is visible to the robot's sensors
Performs a grid-pattern scan to locate the red object, up to 3 times
Runs object detection algorithm targeting the red object
Opens the gripper to 6cm width to prepare for grasp
Moves the gripper above the red object with 5cm vertical offset
Approaches and aligns to the red object with 5mm positional tolerance
Closes gripper to grasp, applying 20N force
Checks if the red object is being held
Raises the grasped red object 10cm above the table

recovery_strategy: Abort and reset if grasp fails after approach or gripper fails
assumptions: Frames confirm the main object is a red cylinder on a dark table; no contradictory distractors visible.
No explicit placement/put-down in frames or instruction, so tree terminates after grasp/lift.
‘red_object’ used as target, matching visual evidence.

expected_success_criteria: Red object is detected, grasped, and lifted from the table
